subject: Handbrake product inquiries
description_text:
Greetings, I bought a stainless steel handbrake a few years ago and recently had a problem with the load cell. Because of this, I purchased a new component, but I didn't pay attention to the connector for the old cell. Right now, I need the electrical diagram information to crimp it correctly.

Could you also tell me the connector specification? I couldn't find it near where I live, maybe I'll have to order it online.

conversations.body_text: Hi Bruno Matos,     Please refer to this RJ11 4P4C connector. The wire color order is: red, white, green, and black.  Most local computer repair shops or PC accessory stores should be able to crimp this type of connector for you.
